### Filtering `NA`s

The `penguines` dataset include some missing values, these can make things complicated. 

How many `bill_len` values are missing? 
```{r}
#| label: Missing Bill Length

sum(is.na(penguins$bill_len)) 
mean(is.na(penguins$bill_len))
```
There are 2 missing values (`sum`) or 0.6% (`mean`). Lets filter the dataset to just keep the missing values. The obvious thing, filtering for `bill_len == NA`, does not work. Use `is.na` instead. 

```{r}
#| label: Keep Missing Values

penguins %>% 
  filter(is.na(bill_len))

```

To keep non missing value using the not operator `!`.
```{r}
#| label: Keep Non Missing Values
#| include: false

penguins %>% 
  filter(!is.na(bill_len))
```
